sentences.sentence: Israel's military steps up its operation in Gaza with an overnight ground assault in the north of the territory, as thousands of injured Palestinians seek treatment.

sentences.sentence: Slovakia's newly sworn in Prime Minister, populist Robert Fico says Bratislava will stop sending weapons to Ukraine. He's also resisted further EU sanctions against Russia.

sentences.sentence: At a conference in Belarus, Hungary's foreign minister has said his country will continue

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: to cooperate with Russia on energy issues, despite the European Union's move to end its reliance on Russian oil and gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Speaking at the Eurasian Security Summit, Peter Sciato said for decades Europe's success has been based on a combination of Western technology and cheap accessible Eastern fossil fuels. From where you buy energy has nothing to do with politics and it's not a political statement. This is a matter of physical reality and since the obligation and responsibility of the Hungarian government is to guarantee the safe supply of energy of the country and since it is physically excluded without the Russian sources we will continue to cooperate in a pragmatic way with Russia as many others do but they don't speak about it Hungary seen by many EU countries as the bloc's most pro-Russian member.

sentences.sentence: That perception was reinforced recently at a summit in China, where Prime Minister Viktor Orban appeared to have friendly talks with the Russian president Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Since its full-scale assault on Ukraine began, Russia has wielded the atomic threat several times. The drills took place hours after the upper house of parliament voted to rescind the ratification of the nuclear test ban treaty after it was approved by the Duma last week. The exercises conducted some 800 kilometers north of the capital were closely monitored by President Vladimir Putin, Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu and the army's chief of staff Valery Gerasimov. The bill will now go to Putin for the final green light. While Russia conducts similar drills every autumn, there is growing concern the Kremlin might increase nuclear testing to discourage Ukraine's western allies from providing military support.

sentences.sentence: Storm Otis had developed into a level five hurricane by the time it hit Mexico's southwest coast close to the beach resort of Acapulco.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: With wind speeds of 270 kilometers an hour and gusts of up to 330 kilometers an hour, it left a trail of damage and destruction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At least one person died, according to media reports. Half a day after the hurricane passed through, power and communications occurred across large parts of the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Otis developed from a tropical storm into a hurricane within 12 hours, giving local people little chance to escape or prepare.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A winged Lamassu sculpture has been discovered in northern Iraq. This mythical creature,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: part bull, part eagle and once with the head of a man, was unearthed by a team of archaeologists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The 2,700-year-old relic was found perfectly preserved underground in the modern-day village of Khursabad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Locals here buried the monument before fleeing the region during the Islamic State occupation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: These ancient alabaster creations once guarded the gates of ancient cities across the Neo-Assyrian Empire, but many were destroyed by militants. The head of the sculpture is on display at the Iraq Museum in Baghdad.
